Extreme weather, agricultural shocks, and energy stress modify GDP & production; **demand destruction from climate policy (carbon pricing, renewable cost parity, electrification) reduces fossil fuel demand triggering asset stranding and petro-state collapse** (`01-climate-system.md`, `01e-climate-energy-demand.md` Demand Destruction, `04v-economy-fossil-assets.md`, `15g-public-finance-petro-state.md`, `04-economy-system.md`)
Desertification, sea-level, and biome shifts update regional geography (`01-climate-system.md` Geographic Impacts, lines 1675-1831)
Extreme weather damages infrastructure assets with degradation mechanics (`09-infrastructure-urbanization-system.md` Climate Damage System)
Climate disasters and temperature anomalies boost green movement strength, impact legitimacy (`01-climate-system.md` Climate  Politics)
Heat, famine, and sea-level rise drive migration & mortality (`01c-climate-sea-level-migration.md`, `05-population-system.md`)
Climate anomalies raise energy-domain R&D pressure (`02-technology-system.md` lines 229-232)
Droughts, sea-level loss, and biome shifts degrade water, arable land, and fossil extraction efficiency (`08-resource-scarcity-system.md` ResourceClimateIntegration)

Climate disasters create generational cohorts with climate-anxious/climate-aware cultural vectors; climate-denial trait decreases with visible damage (`01-climate-system.md` lines 1403-1649, `12-culture-system.md` line 1266, `14-policy-culture-system.md` lines 504-522)

Sea level rise creates new naval strategy opportunities (Arctic routes); desertification affects land mobility; extreme weather damages military infrastructure (`01-climate-system.md` lines 1735-1747 permafrost thaw)

Climate crises above severity threshold trigger UN Security Council humanitarian response proposals; IMF emergency lending for climate-damaged economies (`03-diplomacy-system.md` lines 1207-1241 treaty formation)

Extreme weather disrupts supply chains (shipping delays, port closures); agricultural collapse reduces food exports; climate migration creates labor shortages (`01-climate-system.md` agricultural collapse lines 1403-1517)

Climate-driven mass migration (see `05e-population-mass-migration-core.md`) displaces students/teachers reducing enrollment; extreme disasters damage schools; climate crisis triggers education investment surges in climate science
Climate crises strengthen environmental institutions (universities, conservation NGOs) and weaken affected sectors (agriculture, fishing); major disasters trigger institutional reform/collapse

Warmer temperatures expand disease vectors (mosquito ranges); drought creates waterborne disease risk; climate migration increases pandemic spread; heat stress reduces immune response (`06-pandemic-system.md` lines 191, 216, 226, 414-416, 466-467)

Extreme weather disasters trigger emergency fiscal outlays (disaster relief, reconstruction); long-term climate damage reduces tax bases (`15-public-finance-fiscal-system.md` line 1847 emergency outlays)

Cultural affinity drives alliance formation (+30% if affinity >0.7) and stability bonuses (`12-culture-system.md` lines 2819-2870, `03-diplomacy-system.md` Cultural Affinity & Soft Power lines 2164-2287 with quantified diffusion rates 0.001-0.01/year)

GDP collapse, unemployment, inequality drive regime instability; **worker classification battles (gig vs employee status) create political pressure** (`11-politics-system.md` Economy  Politics, `04t-economy-gig-labor-market.md` Worker Classification); **care worker low wages + parent affordability crisis + employer productivity loss drive policy pressure** (`04u-economy-care-economy.md` 4.5-4.6, `05i-population-family-formation.md` 3.6: wageRatio <0.50  0.70 worker movement, costIndex >0.20  0.80 parent movement, productivity loss 0.05% GDP  0.50 employer pressure)

GDP, unemployment, sector shifts drive fertility/migration; **gig economy precarity (employment volatility, income instability) drives tier dissatisfaction** (`04-economy-system.md`, `04t-economy-gig-labor-market.md` Gig Economy Serfdom); **childcare affordability  fertility penalty + first birth age shift + maternal LFPR drop** (`04u-economy-care-economy.md` Childcare Cost Index, `05i-population-family-formation.md` 3.1-3.3: costIndex 0.33  -0.30 TFR penalty, +1.2 years age shift, -5.2pp LFPR drop); **fossil fuel industry collapse  mass layoffs (USA oil/gas -28%, coal -70%), black lung disease (10-25% prevalence), just transition programs (30-70% success rates), energy region out-migration (Appalachia 3-5M, Alberta 50k), worker radicalization** (`05j-population-energy-workforce.md` Layoff Dynamics, Occupational Health, Just Transition, Migration); planned wage & income feedback loop

GDP and trade determine tax bases and revenue; **petro-state oil revenue dependency (70-95% government revenue) creates extreme fiscal vulnerability to oil price crashes  subsidy cuts (fuel/food)  social unrest  regime collapse** (`15-public-finance-fiscal-system.md` Revenue Mechanics, `15g-public-finance-petro-state.md` Revenue Dependency, Subsidy Crisis: Venezuela $110$30 oil triggered hyperinflation + 5M refugees; Saudi break-even $80-95/barrel; subsidy cuts drove protests: Iran 2019 1,500 dead, Nigeria 2012 general strike)

Wealthy donor generation (billionaires age >50) affects foundation formation; 5% of billionaires found foundations; donor wealth concentration drives endowment growth

Political crises trigger foundation priority shifts: 9/11  security/civil liberties (+15%), 2008 crash  economic development (+20%), 2016 media crisis  journalism (+100%, $150M  $300M), COVID-19  health equity (+25%), George Floyd  racial justice (+200%, $1B  $3B)

Housing affordability ratio (price/income) generates base homelessness rate (15  0.35%, 20  0.48%, 25  0.55%); rent burden >30% accelerates homelessness growth (+10% annual); shelter capacity shortfall drives tent city formation (50+ people threshold); housing construction  shelter alternatives

Party control determines policy choice (National Conservatives 70% criminalization, Social Democrats 70% Housing First); visibility pressure >0.60 triggers action; ideology shapes funding allocation (criminalization 40% enforcement vs Housing First 40% housing); Grants Pass ruling (2024) enables camping bans

Annual budget determines shelter capacity (beds = budget / $50k), intervention program scale (Housing First $15k/person, Treatment First $25k/person, traditional shelter $30/night); fiscal stress reduces shelter construction; budget allocation follows policy (criminalization 40% enforcement, Housing First 40% housing, mixed 25% each)

Police capacity determines sweep frequency (max 1000/year with high capacity); court backlog affects legal challenge success rate (baseline 30%); institutional enforcement capacity enables criminalization policy (arrest rate up to 200 per 1000 homeless/year); jail capacity limits revolving door cycle (3-day average stays)

Mental health capacity determines Treatment First feasibility (availability of counseling, case management); addiction treatment capacity affects program outcomes (baseline 60% dropout, adequate treatment reduces to 40%); healthcare system determines Housing First support services quality (mental health, addiction treatment, case management affect retention 77-91%)
Planned forward: population demographics affect homelessness vulnerability (age, disability, addiction rates)
